body: I believe that when I changed the `ffmpeg.py` the last time to make it configurable via `video2x.json`, I broke a lot of stuff since when the options are being read, they are no longer in the correct order. I will double check on the final stage to see if I can find out where it went wrong.
@cr08 do happen you have a sample video that I can test with?
Sorry for the late reply. Real life got in the way. I can get you a couple sample clips directly from files I'm working with.
@cr08 yes please. Zip it and upload it here? or any other way that you'd like.

Here's two clips I've been working with:

[clips.zip](https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/files/3244522/clips.zip)

I upscaled both of them and it works just fine for me.

[output.zip](https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/files/3268683/output.zip)
@cr08 could you please see if the newest commit (https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/commit/8e85d6a6d37796f70938fa81c81e3e0962ad6bbc) fixed the problem for you?

Getting closer. So the clip I sent you, filename `CL_S01E00-clip.mkv` which has two audio tracks. Ran it again and it still only gets the first audio track but it does a direct copy. Seems somewhere along the line the migrate stage is only grabbing one of the `-map` directives in the json. Or given the ordering somehow it is saying `-map` should come first given the json config but the actual value it's pulling is the last one in the config? Overall my vague guess is something isn't liking having multiple of the same directives in the same command? I'm not seeing any other instances of this in other stages.

```
INFO: Executing: ['C:\\Users\\cr08\\AppData\\Local\\video2x\\ffmpeg-latest-win64-static
\\bin\\ffmpeg.exe', '-i', 'C:\\Users\\cr08\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\video2x\\tmpdd6ouaag\\no_audio.mp4', 
'-i', 'C:\\Users\\cr08\\Videos\\test\\CL_S01E00-clip.mkv', '-map', '-1:v?', '-c', 'copy', '-pix_fmt', 'yuv420p', 
'C:\\Users\\cr08\\Documents\\GitHub\\video2x\\bin\\sample_out.mkv', '-y']
```

@Aidolii found another issue last night (#102). Basically there was a typo that influences the program muxing stage.

Sorry about this back and fourth. Could you please check the newest version posted last night?
I actually did that test with the latest commit 1280a79 and came up with the results mentioned.

Yep. That is all there. Just to save my sanity I even tried pulling a fresh copy of the repo and reviewing the json about 3 times. It's still doing the same thing with the same INFO line I listed above.
@cr08 Can you send me your entire video2x folder along with a bat file containing the command you've been using? With only the relevant clips of course.
